website_summaries.verdict: The Milliard Diplomat bed is sturdy, durable, easy to fold and likely to give many years of service. The firm mattress may be a deterrent to some buyers, but overall, this bed is one of the best on the market.
pros: With its lattice-wired base and super-reinforced steel frame, the Milliard Premium bed is about as comfortable as folding beds get
cons: Users have reported the bed is very firm and that the mattress is 4" rather than 5", as advertised

customer_reviews.title: The bed itself is OK, however, when you ...
customer_reviews.text: The bed itself is OK, however, when you fold the bed for storage and try to engage the clasp that holds both sides together, it is not strong enough. The bed keeps opening and won't stay in the closed position. After the first few tries, the clasp broke. Contacted the company to ask if they can provide a replacement clasp which is stronger and would hold the bed in the closed position. Never heard back from them.....
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Patrizio

customer_reviews.title: What a great choice! The Milliard Diplomat was easy to assemble ...
customer_reviews.text: We read all the reviews about the PREMIUM version of this bed and decided to go with the DIPLOMAT version because we don't want the bed to sag EVER. What a great choice! The Milliard Diplomat was easy to assemble and very lightweight considering the metal frame. My 90 year old mother-in-law spent the weekend with us and she loved it. She said it was the first time in years that she actually slept the ENTIRE night. She usually gets up often because of back pain or comfort issues. We are going to look into getting her a new mattress. LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Marcia A. Tulio

customer_reviews.title: Quality Folding Bed
customer_reviews.text: I've been sleeping for several weeks now in the Milliard Diplomat Folding Bed and it is very sturdy and and well built. I am a fairly big guy at 320 pounds and have had no issues with sagging or creaking. The memory foam mattress is quite comfortable, however, I do wish the mattress was a little thicker than 5 inches. I would recommend this bed.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph W. Casale

customer_reviews.title: Good to go
customer_reviews.text: Assembly is super simple. Comes with a plush mattress. Bed will last for generations. Welded very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Wash House

customer_reviews.title: Might not be the best for heavier houseguests...slow shipping
customer_reviews.text: The bed was a week and half late shipping from what was said so our guest had to sleep on the couch for most of the holiday. Once it did come, it was easy to put together but he said it was so uncomfortable that he moved back to our old lumpy couch. It will be fine in a pinch but disappointed over all. It could also be that our guest was over 300lbs so the mattress just couldn't support his weight. Will try again.
customer_reviews.author: Katharine L. Stadler

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed. The cot I received had a bent frame
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed. The cot I received had a bent frame, numerous scratches, paint chipped off, the screw holes did not match and I am sure this is a product that was returned from someone else as the box was tapped up numerous times not to mention the bad condition.
customer_reviews.author: FRAN D.

customer_reviews.title: Mattress is VERY HARD...
customer_reviews.text: The bed arrived on time and was easy to set up. IT was nice and compact and doesn't take up much room fully set up. I wanted to give it a try before our guests come for the Holidays so I decided to sleep a full night on it. To my disappointment, it was hard as a rock!!!! I didn't last the full night on it! I like a firm mattress but this was so hard it was very uncomfortable. We returned it after the weekend :(
customer_reviews.author: River A DeLiso

customer_reviews.title: Not very stable, QC not good
customer_reviews.text: Poorly made, no QC, braces didn't fit into stabilizer bolts, was very difficult to get together.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Very hard mattress
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my way now to go buy a topper for the 4 inch memory foam mattress so my guests will be able to sleep. It is very hard! I'm so disappointed because I live in a one-bedroom condo, am a widow and live on social security. This purchase was a lot of money for me to pay for this, and I took a long time to make the decision. I don't even know where I will store the topper! So disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Deanie K.

customer_reviews.title: cheap, unfoldable, broke on first use
customer_reviews.text: The mattress head is flimsy and sheet metal and the screws popped right through the holes in the frame when trying to strap the bed closed. Couldn't they afford four washers? The bed cannot be closed. Also, the strap is confusing, Very frustrated!
customer_reviews.author: Rich D

customer_reviews.title: Beyond firm
customer_reviews.text: I have other rollaways from same brand and those rollaways are far more comfortable. The best thing I can say is that it is industrial. Heavy duty with a grated platform for the thin mattress that has ZERO give - put the mattress on the floor. Additional there are 4 support arms that need to be secured every time you open or close the bed - super secure but what a pain and requires considerable force. It is hard to believe this is supposed to be a 'better' bed. My 11-year-old thought it was 'OK'
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Kohler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, but look for defective hardware.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, a very sturdy frame. The hardware is certainly not up to par. I had a castor wheel with a severely messed up thread that would not thread into the frame. In the end, it had to be forced through the thread and JB Weld applied to keep it secure. It works well as-is. All other castor wheels were in perfect condition. My advice would be to inventory ALL hardware and do a thorough inspection. How this wheel passed QA is beyond me.
customer_reviews.author: bonjour82

customer_reviews.title: Spare bed..
customer_reviews.text: Mattress is comfortable, very easy to put together. It does store nice. The reason for 4 stars and not 5 is the strap that holds the bed together when not in use snapped clean off the second use. UPDATE: The company was very responsive and is sending new straps, changing review to 5 stars as great customer service is paramount
customer_reviews.author: FLJJD

customer_reviews.title: Mattress isn’t worth it super think like a sheet of cardboard
customer_reviews.text: Box was damaged pieces were missing no screws one of the ends were bent. Mattress isn’t worth it super think like a sheet of cardboard.
customer_reviews.author: steven l shirey

customer_reviews.title: Very nice bed for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with slight damage...the u-shaped tubes were bent at the ends and prevented opening the legs. I quick unbending with a channelocks straightened them out. I would suggest plastic shipping caps be placed on these delicate tubes. Other than that, installation only took a few minutes. Mattress is about as comfy as can get for a portable bed. The hype about a box within a box doesn't really hold credibility as the inside box just squeezes into outer box with no space or resiliant packing materials between the two. Thus UPS was easily able to crush the box and bend the ends of the tubing.
customer_reviews.author: Bob M

customer_reviews.title: Shipment just a bit delayed but we got it (expect delays)
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this bed for a guest at Christmas. The package is large and heavy and a couple of carriers could not deliver it to our suburban Twin Cities home for about 3 days. Finally a UPS driver was able to bring it to our door. It was well-protected with packaging and clean. We opened it immediately and let the mattress expand and air out in our living room, but detected no nasty odor. Mattress was fully expanded several hours later. I ordered an extra foam mattress cover and the combo with flannel sheets will make our guest really cozy on a Minnesota winter night!
customer_reviews.author: mamakat

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a quality product.  Sturdy; mattress seems ok. Haven't had anybody sleep on it yet.
customer_reviews.text: Just put it together and it seems like a nice sturdy bed. The mattress is ok too. Our guest will be here for Christmas and will sleep on it, so will have to get back to how comfortable it is. Bought a thick mattress pad to go over the mattress for added comfort. It was simple to put together. All the parts needed and tools came with the product. The strap to hold the bed together after it is folded up was flimsy and the plastic piece on it broke in two before even using it. Not a big deal. We had a very strong luggage strap that we were able to adjust and use and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsy

customer_reviews.title: The bed itself is great, BUT....
customer_reviews.text: The bed itself is great, but the hook to close it broke after using it only for 3 days. I was able to put it together easily, and it is very comfortable, but it is very difficult to get both ends together to fold it up in order to store it. So, if you are going to just put it together and leave it open for use, it is perfect. But if you need to fold it up and store it on a daily basis, you may want to either try a different brand or go ahead and invest in a different strap.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Hill

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality Folding Bed meeting all your needs
customer_reviews.text: This fold-up bed is like a regular twin and just as comfortable. It is firm, but it supports my body very well. I have been using it for about 3 days and the firmness is lessening a bit. I have severe arthritis, and I sleep well on this bed. For the first time in about 2 years and without sleeping pills, I got a great night's sleep. We purchased the cover for this bed since we have to fold it up and store it everyday. It is easy to store once you go thru the process a few times. The quality of the construction is excellent and the design was very well thought-out.
customer_reviews.author: Juniper

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality and functional bed.
customer_reviews.text: Glad I read the reviews prior to purchasing, they were helpful. Our bed did arrive with partially destroyed box, but the box damage did not affect the bed or contents. The Frame is quite stout and sturdy, nicely made and easy to assemble. Our displaced daughter slept on it for three weeks. Having a solid grid for the mattress to lay on, for us, was critical as we prefer supportive firm beds. While the memory foam mattress was nice and sufficiently comfortable, I purchased a feather bed topper which worked well. I would recommend this bed without hesitation and would purchase it again in a second!
customer_reviews.author: nerfnerd

customer_reviews.title: First impressions of this folding bed.
customer_reviews.text: So I just purchased it hasn't been used but after opening it I was expecting something a lot more higher quality for the price that I paid. The wheels are plastic and one of the welds to secure the wheels to the frame was not verified for straightness. Assembly was easy and quick. Mattress seems decent, thinner that I thought. I was going for height when I was looking for a folding bed. So I hope that this bed will work for someone that has had both hips replaced a couple of years ago. Will update more later.
customer_reviews.author: wize

customer_reviews.title: Solid folding bed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for occasional use. Have not slept a full night on it but it feels comfortable for it, also seems very solid. Under the mattress is a solid cage not springs so the mattress is memory foam but firm. Only drawback, the 4 angles to secure the drop down legs are a little tough to secure and remove. An older person with low hand strength could have a problem. Maybe Vaseline grease would help, haven’t tried.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Great extra bed!
customer_reviews.text: The bed arrived yesterday, just as promised. It was supremely packaged so came in perfect condition. The frame was easy to assemble per good instructions. No one has slept on the bed yet but it seems to be quite comfortable. I would recommend this bed to anyone who needs an extra bed.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Has a plastic part that will break and need replacing.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good bed, but the hook used to keep it closed has one fatal flaw: it's poorly designed. When I got this bed, I told myself that it would break in a couple weeks. Unfortunately, I was right. The plastic used to mount it to one side of the bed broke as I was folding it. Would I buy it again? Yes. Would I replace the hook used to keep it closed with something more durable? Yes.
customer_reviews.author: David Sisler

customer_reviews.title: WOW What Comfort!
customer_reviews.text: Can't get over how comfortable this 'Millard Folding Bed – Twin Size' is. Husband set it up day before our visitor arrived. Laid down on it in front of the TV to watch the evening news. I'm making dinner and the next thing I know, he's snoring. Had to walk over and wake him when dinner was ready. Our visitor said she always has hip pain, whenever sleeping on her side. Upon awakening, she exclaimed she had absolutely no pain from sleeping on this 'Luxurious Memory Foam Mattress'! Definitely a terrific purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BLANDINE T JIRSCHELE

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bed for my living room for my sister to sleep on, while she was staying with me after I had hip surgery. She said it was ok. After she left, my 15-year-old goddaughter has been staying with me off and on. She has been very happy with the bed. I've left it unfolded in the LR because it's so much more comfortable than the chair I usually have in that spot. I've spent a lot of time sitting and lying in it after my surgery and have found it very comfortable. I haven't actually slept on it at night but have taken naps and it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: Linden

customer_reviews.title: Nice bed for the money
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of searching for a folding bed. This one had pretty good reviews so i gave it a shot. I am just under 300lb and the frame is very sturdy with no sag or noise. The mattress is memory foam. It does need almost a day to fully expand. In my case, i got a 3" memory foam topper to go with it due to my weight. The two combined make it very comfortable and supportive. I do not feel the solid frame when laying down and my back pain actually improved. If you are lighter, or using it for kids, I would guess the provided mattress is sufficient on its own. I would recommend this bed.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Sprinter Van - mobile - my bed is folded till I need it - extreme sturdy and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I love this bed - I also got a padded mattress cover - to help keep it clean and also covered all with fitted sheets (all left installed while folded - this is important to me as I have the bed in my Sprinter 2500 Cargo - folded - till I need it. I got a zippered black dust cover made by the same company too. Comfort and stability is excellent. I truly would not change anything. I had some reservation re the latch (while folded) as I had these extras (padded mattress cover and fitted sheet) but it works great - every single time.
customer_reviews.author: Rob D. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Twin Bed for grandson’s visits!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Milliard Diplomat folding bed in twin size for when my four year old grandson stays at our house. It was easy to get it ready, and seems sturdy. Grandson slept on it and told me he had good sleeping. The mattress is firm, but I think that will help prevent sagging. It is awesome to be able to provide him a twin bed and then just roll it into the corner (we have a small house!). It would be nice to have some raised areas on the frame so the mattress doesn’t slide (it’s the mattress encasement that causes it to slide). Will probably figure out a way to make it stay put. I do recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Solid, firm, comfortable bed
customer_reviews.text: Firm, yes. Comfortable if you like a firm mattress, yes. Of course I have a two inch memory foam topper on it. My only gripe was I had to file down part of the frame to make it lock in place but it was only a 5 minute job with the tools I had. Great replacement for my multiple air mattresses that I've been using over the years (I sleep on a mattress nearly 50% of my nights for work). I had to get used to this one, but after a few days it was great.
customer_reviews.author: WickerCat

customer_reviews.title: One of the caster holes was not properly drilled
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable enough and not too difficult to put together. Main problem was that I had to UNSCREW three of the casters to match as closely as possible the one that would not go all the way in. Since this bed will not be moved often it shouldn't be a problem, but if it was moved frequently I would expect the caster situation to become a problem.
customer_reviews.author: OLDteacher

customer_reviews.title: Well built, comfy and great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: This folding bed is very comfortable and well built. I did a lot of research before purchasing this bed and decided on this one because of the way it was built. The mattress is very soft and th guests love it. I had a minor issue, however, the Millard company reached out to me in less than 24 hours with a moat excellent solution. I highly recommend this bed and this company.
customer_reviews.author: London B

customer_reviews.title: It's nice for a small guest or child
customer_reviews.text: It's nice for a small guest or child. Comfort wise like sleeping on a couch. I like the how it folds up to store away. Make sure you get the storage bag to keep the dust out.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Duong

customer_reviews.title: Felt like a normal bed!
customer_reviews.text: Needed an extra bed fast and didnt think I had a chance of getting anything worth using more than once. I was wrong. My guest was really surprised at how comfortable it was. The memory foam is thick. Its not stiff at all and you cant feel any of the bed bars underneath. It really just felt like laying on a regular bed. Seems to be good quality. Felt very sturdy. Easy to put together. Easy to fold. Fits normal twin bedding. Bought the cover for clean storage. I would recommend that.
customer_reviews.author: Anna L

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and Comfort
customer_reviews.text: My 14 yr old sleeping on it and she is about 130 lbs, she says so comfy. I offered to buy a mattress topper and she said not needed. Good as is. Very happy and highly recommend. Slight problem with the legs at each in, supposed to snap into place, I had to unscrew and put into place and then screw back in. But I will have no worry of it collapsing. Appears that the legs were machined incorrectly. My daughter also bought and the legs popped into place a instructions indicate. Overall very good value.
customer_reviews.author: BestGramsEver

customer_reviews.title: Good folding bed. One leg brace does not lock.
customer_reviews.text: The bed was easy to assemble and the mattress itself is comfortable. However, one of the leg braces did not want to fall in place as other other 3. It felt more stiff and was made a little longer a problem in manufacturing. Leaving the brace is a major hazard as applying weight can cause the bed to collapse. To solve this problem you have to force the brace into the bolt by forcing the leg to open a little more while pushing it down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality and surprisingly comfortable foldaway bed
customer_reviews.text: Well-made - no sharp edges, solid, great support Mattress - the 6'3" son slept comfortably on it Long - the 6'3" son says it was a good fit Folding - a helper pushing from the other side is a good thing Securing - must be an improved version but mine came with a locking bar that hooks securely around a nub You'll want to try and set it up so your head side is against a wall or something that will keep the pillow from falling off. But overall, very impressed with this. Worth it.
customer_reviews.author: virwill

customer_reviews.title: A great temporary bed
customer_reviews.text: If you have older out of town guests that can't take a futon on the floor, this is the perfect temp bed solution. There's no bar in the middle of the back feeling you get with sofa beds and other trundles I've seen. It's a good, thick memory foam. A little on the firm side, so if you love that you will adore this bed. (I put on a secondary egg shell foam for my mom.) It folds up, and I bought bungee cords to hang it from the rafters in my garage for easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie Warner

customer_reviews.title: It is a good folding bed.
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted to buy this for guest overflow. I was skeptical, but it turned out to be a good bed. It is sturdy enough and comfortable enough to be used by adults or children. The only problem we had was getting the locking braces on the legs to engage with the locking pins. It is a tight fit as it should be, but after the first use it was easier to engage the locking pins.
customer_reviews.author: Leo L.

customer_reviews.title: Very good guest bed - Has room for improvement.
customer_reviews.text: I just slept on this bed for five nights and got some good sleep. If you need a good guest bed, this is it. It is a very firm memory foam mattress with a strong wire frame support. It can be improved by making the mattress longer. I’m 5’11” and just barely fit on the bed. It could also be improved by making the mattress thicker and by adding spring supports and a canvas support instead of ridged wires.
customer_reviews.author: Elsewhere

customer_reviews.title: Great solid & comfortable guest bed
customer_reviews.text: This folding bed is just what I needed. The feel of the mattress is similar to my queen memory foam mattress, i.e., it is firm. The frame is solid & strong, no shaking & it was easy to assemble.It folds easily & rolls away nicely. It is a perfect solution for a small room. It takes a lot of space in my closet, but it was the perfect opportunity to get rid of stuff that I don't need.
customer_reviews.author: Techy Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Not new as stated but good customer service
customer_reviews.text: I was not happy with the bed. It came scratched and a little damaged .The part to lock the bed was incomplete. The mattress had a part wich was not square at corner ( maybe I got a bad one/ defective) But they have a good customer service . They refunded me . They offered the option to donate the bed or destroy the mattress . I changed my rating because they are a good company, even if their product was not for me .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for a few nights
customer_reviews.text: I'm 40. I have back issues. The Milliard Diplomat bed is far superior than any air mattress I've used over the years. 1. It's firm (like, SUPER firm) 2. It's silent (no creaking when I turnover in the night) 3. It will never deflate 4. It's just the right size (queen airbeds take up too much space, while twin airbeds are too small/unsteady) 5. It's so easy to set up/take down
customer_reviews.author: hannaberry78

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product and definitely a good purchasing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this folding bed because I had guest(s) spending time with us for the holidays. They stayed a total of 10 days and slept on this bed every single night. I figured that they would have complained about some form of discomfort/backache.....BUT to my surprise they kept saying how COMFORTABLE the folding bed was! I can’t tell you how happy I was to hear that and how incredibly pleased I am with is product. Milliard thank you for making such a great product! Your hard work and dedication to your brand is truly appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great guest bed!
customer_reviews.text: This bed is great - it exceeded all my expectations. Assembly was easy, frame is sturdy and we'll designed, mattress is good, folded size is good and it's ready to roll. I picked up a luxury fiber bed, a mattress cover and good quality bedding. It was a great guest bed for my 75+ year old mother. I bought a second.
customer_reviews.author: N. Rudin

customer_reviews.title: Now I have a proper guest room
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on recommendation of a friend who has a guesthouse. My elderly dad needs a place to sleep when he visits me. This was easy to open and assemble. There was little to no odor and we allowed the mattress to expand and air out for a week before using it. My dad said the height is good and the bed is firm. I'll add a mattress topper for those who like a softer mattress. Folds easily. I wish I had a closet to stash it in but it is fine tucked in to a corner of my office when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: evk0109

customer_reviews.title: comfortable bed - problem with bracket/clasp that is used to secure the legs
customer_reviews.text: The bed is very comfortable as long as you can get the brackets to secure the legs. I've owned the bed for 5 months and the mechanism to secure the legs is hard to secure. I reached out to the vendor and they shipped me 2 extra brackets and I'm missing one of the plastic washers. This bed is not designed for repeated use and you must be mechanically inclined to use
customer_reviews.author: davetek

customer_reviews.title: Three of them were moved into place fairly easily. The fourth one was slightly different in size ...
customer_reviews.text: The main problem was the assembly of the bed. The bars that serve as the feet of the bed are stabilized by two metal struts. Three of them were moved into place fairly easily. The fourth one was slightly different in size and required creative bending to be put into place and took a long time. The mattress is only moderately comfortable and does not provide enough support for an average person
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Questionable Quality
customer_reviews.text: The product had manufacturing issues. The nut welded the bottom of the frame was not centered on the opening in the frame so one of the wheels would not screw securely into the frame. Had to add washers to make up the space on the remaining three wheels. Also, the folding joint on the frame (which exists for packaging and shipping) was bent-though not badly enough such that it could not be corrected.
customer_reviews.author: evjw

customer_reviews.title: Bed
customer_reviews.text: The bed was as described , but it is too hard for me
customer_reviews.author: terri_103

customer_reviews.title: Products that are made correctly and having all the parts to the product.
customer_reviews.text: The assembly of the bed frame was terrible. One side was bent or not lined up right. I need another bed frame. My mattress was in great shape
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Comfort with an A rating
customer_reviews.text: My husband has a bad back but we really needed a cot for staying somewhere. Was hesitant about buying this but the memory foam sold me and I figured I could add another layer of memory foam if I needed. Well after the first nights sleep my husbands back felt good. No need to add extra foam. Very comfortable and very easy to put up
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline

customer_reviews.title: Comfort beyond belief!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Let me start out by saying that I don't write a whole lot of reviews because you usually just get what you pay for or something really cheap that looked like a good deal. I have had this bed for over a month now and have slept in it every night because I do snow removal and I need a different room with peace and quiet. It is amazing! Very firm and the memory foam is just the same as the first time I slept in it. In fact it is more comfortable than the bed I sleep in the rest of the year that I spent several thousand dollars on! You won't be disappointed in this bed!
customer_reviews.author: mike wickersham

customer_reviews.title: Stinky mattress
customer_reviews.text: I gave a two star overall rating due to the strong mildewed odor coming from the mattress. After leaving it outside to air out and spraying it down with ferbreeze and other sprays the odor is still there will be returning it
customer_reviews.author: dispatch1156

customer_reviews.title: The wheels bend!
customer_reviews.text: I would give this product a 5 star for the mattress itself, its perfect and very comfortable but the bed frame broke around the wheel area. Unfortunately I can’t exchange or return because it’s past warranty. Just keep in mind of those wheels bending.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Ortega

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly comfortable and I could not tell I was sleeping on a fold-up bed. I am average weight for a 5’8” male. Slept on it for days after my parents left until I needed to reclaim the space in my apt. Disclosure: While I was able to easily and safely turn in the bed, I am not one that rolls around too much. The bed would be too narrow for you if you do roll around.
customer_reviews.author: Gee Iggy

customer_reviews.title: Safety Issue
customer_reviews.text: Three of the four brackets that secure the legs in place with the bed open would not align properly to lock the legs onto the frame. This is a safety hazard as the legs could collapse while the bed is in use.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Suits the Purpose
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for our vacation home for times when we pack folks in. They were easy to assemble but one or two of the wheel hole weren't drilled right so that took some work. I used them for my two girls and they seemed comfy but I also added a memory foam topper and mattress pad. The mattress itself seems good but I don't see an adult sleeping super comfortably in it for very many nights. Folding them up and putting in the closets is key and easy to do.
customer_reviews.author: Dina

customer_reviews.title: Fed Ex delivered and left it on the porch.
customer_reviews.text: I’m 78 years old in July, and I assembled this myself. Granted I’m in pretty good health so, there’s that. It was easy enough to figure out with only one little snag. The metal at the connector joint didn’t want to go down so I stood on it. Works for me. I will use it for guests and I think it’s pretty comfy. I hope my guests think so.
customer_reviews.author: Judith Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Over rated for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Locking and unlocking the legs on the frame is difficult, the linkages should be automatic and are not. The mattress slides about 1 inch from head to toe when the bed frame is extended for sleeping. The frame where the legs fold had sharp edges that ripped a small hole on the mattress. Initial assembly of the bed frame could be much improved. The bed frame is sturdy, the mattress is adequate for comfort. I think the price was on the high side based on the negative comments given above.
customer_reviews.author: RL Guillen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, full twin
customer_reviews.text: Used for family holiday/weekend visits. Came in a large box so I needed help getting it into house; however that meant there wasn't much assembly needed! Pulled out the mattress and gave it full 24 hrs to get to full size. Comfortable for a few nights visit; not skimpy or narrow. Easy to fold frame up to stow in closet, but I could not re-fold the mattress into the frame ... it kept bouncing open, so I put back in plastic bag it came in and slid under another bed in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Craig

customer_reviews.title: Nice Roll-away Bed
customer_reviews.text: Overall happy with this purchase. Nice roll-away to have when guest visit. When you first unpack the bed, make sure you allow time for the mattress to rise to its full thickness by keeping it opened for a few hours.. Fairly easy to put together, my son did it by himself with no problem. I added a gel type topper for added cushion. My only disappointment was the buckle was broken so I have to tie it in a knot to keep it folded.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Much better than sleeping in a lazyboy all night!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered as an alternative to sleeping in lazy-boy chair at my 85 year old mother's residence. Received the date as promised. Put together in a matter of minutes. Slept on it once so far, no complaints. The box was in perfect condition when received. No damage to box or contents. (Way to go UPS) Also purchased the storage cover since bed is only used on weekends. So far very happy with purchases. Prior to purchasing this folding bed I was sleeping the night in a lazy-boy chair.
customer_reviews.author: gidget08

customer_reviews.title: This mattress is extremely comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I had company for the holidays. They loved this mattress! They said it was more comfortable than their bed at home. I love this fact that twin sheets and blankets fit well. It is very easy to open and store. I have two now.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This bed is fantastic. Very easy to put together. I have a small house and needed a place for my college student granddaughter to stay. Setting up a regular twin bed would take up too much room. This bed is perfect. And it is not cot sized. The mattress is quite firm, and the wire frame is very supportive. This is much better than the trampoline-style squeaky frames, like on my pull-out sofa.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect sleeper for our small, retirement home. We knew that we'd be having family and friends visit, but not enough spaces for everyone to sleep. This stores and folds out easily. And, it big enough for my 6' tall son. We tried an air mattress at first, but there simply is no comparison to the quality of comfort between the two. We are very pleased with this product and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Deb H.

customer_reviews.title: Fairly comfortable folding bed for staying a few days overnight
customer_reviews.text: The bed was missing a bolt when it arrived. It was easy to put together. It's fairly comfortable when sleeping on it for several days. Very easy to store. My only complaint is that the bed very close to the ground. I plan to add a mattress topper. I think that might help raise it off the floor some and add more sleeping comfort. Shortly after I contacted the manufacturer, they rushed out a bag of bolts, but didn't provide any nuts. I simply went to Home Depot and picked up a nut rather than go back to the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for family and/or friends who have uncomfortable beds in their guest rooms!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this roll-away as an additional guest bed. Wanted it to be high quality and very comfortable. The Milliard Diplomat filled the bill. The only problem was that a leg brace and rivet did not connect. Decided to overlook that as everything else was perfect and the leg was well supported from the other side. My 6 ' 3" adult son spent a very comfortable night on this bed. I was so happy with this bed that I immediately turned around and ordered the zippered cover. It is also of high quality and fits beautifully. If you purchase this bed, for sure you will want the cover.
customer_reviews.author: Auntiemame

customer_reviews.title: Great rollaway bed! Will not disappoint!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this rollaway cot for when our grandkids visit. It came well packaged and pretty easy to assemble but you will need a wrench as the one included only did a fair job. The bed is very comfortable. We were very pleased. And we purchased the cover, too, which protects it when not in use. In my opinion the mattress is so comfortable that you do not need a mattress topper. I highly recommend this bed.
customer_reviews.author: Florida girl

customer_reviews.title: Durable and well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I got this bed in June for my guests to sleep on. All 3 people who have slept on this bed throughout the summer have all said it was the most comfortable roll away bed they have ever slept on. It’s easy to assembly, fold and set up. I bought the cover as well to help preserve the mattress. Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Strong frame, weak mattress.
customer_reviews.text: I love the frame, which can easily support 300 pounds, but not the foam mattress pad & here's why. When you sleep on your back, your body weight is spread out over a larger surface area than when you sleep on your side. The foam pad compresses under the greater pounds per square inch for side sleepers and you feel the metal frame through the foam pad. It's appropriate for children, petite adults and those who sleep on their backs.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew P.Howley

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy comfort.
customer_reviews.text: This bed arrived in a short amount of time. It was very easy to put together and it is well built. I bought this for my son who is recently home from college. The matress is 5, inches thick (make a fist and just a little wider than that). I am 6' tall and weigh 255 lbs. I found it comfortable. I will probably get my son a 2inch foam topper to ensure it stays comfortable until we can get him his own space bed. I definitely recommend this bed.
customer_reviews.author: Mightyq

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: This twin sized folding bed was shipped in a heavy duty cardboard carton and delivered on time and in excellent condition. All of the necessary parts were included and the bed frame went together easily within minutes. The frame itself seems very sturdy and is noise-free when lying or rolling over on the foam mattress. The mattress takes regular twin size sheets which made it ever-so-easy to make the bed! A great bed and I'm ready for company!
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: A nice solid bed, but the mattress is only 3" thick. Add a memory foam topper for more comfort.
customer_reviews.text: A great spare bed. Full twin size, and a solid frame. The lesser side is that the mattress is not bad, but only 3" thick. So you do notice and feel the frame underneath at times. I added a 1.5" memory foam topper and this bed was really comfortable after that. I'm 6'2" and weigh 236 and I was very comfortable on this. Even with the topper left on, I was able to fold this up and slide it into the closet with no trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a family visit. The family member thought it was very hard and didn’t have a lot of give. Very uncomfortable. Several others tried it as well, same concern.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just need to update the closing strap.everything else is great.
customer_reviews.text: Best bed ever so soft but firm,and strong. Nice looking too, Medal wheels not plastic like other beds. Millard diplomat folding bed hope you sell a million. I have bin looking for a fold up bed for months and I bought one from a department store and it was a cheep piece of ?? . The bed is wider then the one I perchest from store.and the mattress is thicker,win,win.for me.
customer_reviews.author: william burns

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy extra bed. I was dreading putting this thing together, ever-wary of anything that claims "easy assembly." But hey, assembly really WAS easy!
customer_reviews.author: AndAnotherThing

customer_reviews.title: A great surprise!
customer_reviews.text: When I was thinking about buying a portable folding bed, I fully expected it to be uncomfortable but tolerable because after all, it is a folding bed. To my surprise this bed is the most comfortable folding bed I have ever experienced (and I have slept on a few). I bought this bed for a friend who is staying with me for an extended visit and find myself napping on it because it is soooooo very comfortable. I can't say that enough! I am very pleased and satisfied with my purchase. The frame was easy to assemble, it is sturdy, supportive, memory foam mattress (no springs!) very very nice. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Lori F.

customer_reviews.title: A little too firm mattress
customer_reviews.text: Four different people (two women, two men) have used this twin sized bed. They all say a little too firm, so I will be purchasing a topper and deep pocket sheet. But...they all said bed more comfortable than a cot-sized rollaway, and the framing feels firm so they feel more secure getting in and out of bed.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: bigger than you think, hard to store.
customer_reviews.text: Full size bed, not a little cot. Even folded it is huge. Once we're through using it, I have no idea where I'll store it. It doesn't fit in any of our closets. The mattress is still pretty thin, We ordered a separate 3 inch egg crate to go on top, just so the sheets would fit. Good bed, but don't but not good for short uses and storing.
customer_reviews.author: HB

customer_reviews.title: Overrated
customer_reviews.text: Cheap quality workmanship -- screw holes poorly drilled, had burrs making it impossible to insert screws until cleaned out with another tool. Plastic slide buckle on hook strap broke promptly, causing need to hand-tie the hook strap to the holding bar. Wheel locks do not hold securely. Frame locks are difficult to maneuver when setting the bed up, hard on fingers. Bed does not sit up straight and tilts when standing folded. Doesn't roll straight, either. Difficult for one person to roll from room to room. Mattress is hard, not comfortable at all. Wouldn't buy it again. I'd invest more in a better quality guest bed.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Nice bed, great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, have had several guests sleep on it for multiple nights with no complaints. Easy to fold and roll in big closet out of the way when not using it! Was worried because it was $$$ but wanted something good, as we have multiple guests a lot. Works great for kids and adults!
customer_reviews.author: Chandra

customer_reviews.title: Ready For Company
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this 10 stars I would. Super easy to unbox, it came with a box in a box. Arrived on time with no damage to packaging. Strong frame heavy duty, with a plush mattress. It took me longer to shorten the buckle to latch closed than it did to put the bed together. I also purchased the cover for storage, heavy weight canvas. Fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Minnie n Rudy

customer_reviews.title: super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bed to sleep on when I have company and give up my own bed, so I can say it is super comfortable. The mattress is firm but not hard you don't feel the wires at all. I weigh 130 pounds if that helps.
customer_reviews.author: alice mallek

customer_reviews.title: Glad I picked this folding bed.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this folding bed for several weeks now feel great about this purchase. The bed delivers everything they promised. The mattress is comfortable (I like the firmness), the bed frame is sturdy (solid - no movement when set up), it is easy to fold up and to move. Putting everything together was simple and straight forward. I would recommend the Milliard Diplomat Folding Bed to anyone who needs a reliable, sturdy, and comfortable true twin-sized folding bed.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Amiot

customer_reviews.title: and easy enough for me to set up an move (at ...
customer_reviews.text: I compared reviews for over 20 folding beds to ensure I found one that would fit my 6 ft son, had support and no sagging anywhere, had ends on the bed so the mattress wouldn't slip as it does on many models, a thick mattress , and easy enough for me to set up an move (at 5'1") and this bed has everything!!. My son said it as super comfortable during his visit and I would absolutely recommend the product. Very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable guest bed.
customer_reviews.text: I got this bed a few weeks ago for guests and waited until it was used to submit my review. The bed was EXTREMELY easy to put together and fold up and it was rated SUPER comfortable by my guest. I also lounged on it for a while too and it is really nice. Having the sturdy metal frame/slats is much better than wood slats. I love having the extra space for guests. No more sleeping on the old couch!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy White

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic folding bed, very comfortable, our guest slept on this for three weeks, my wife has been sleeping on it for weeks now because she snores so bad and she thinks it’s way better than the couch. Super easy to fold up and set up, does not squeak when moving around while sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: bobthetoolman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I received the bed in two boxes, as was described. It was packaged well, with the mattress rolled up and sealed. All the parts for assembly were included. All that needed to be done was insert four knob screws on the middle hinge areas, screw in the four wheels, and then screw in the handles on either end. After locking in the four braces, the bed was assembled. I was able to do this by myself with no help. It seems to be comfortable, though I have yet to use it.
customer_reviews.author: J. E. Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy comfort in a rollaway
customer_reviews.text: I've been sleeping on our new twin bed () for a few nights. No bars to hurt your back or hips; comfortable memory foam mattress; feels sturdy, not flimsy or portable; but it IS portable and pretty easy to put away. I've been getting a good night's sleep and waking up very cozy. My existing twin sheets fit fine, although the fitted sheet pockets were deeper than the mattress required. I appreciated the support from Tzippora in Customer Service, who helped me figure out the strap and hook to secure it when it's folded up. Might need to order a zippered cover, since this will be stored in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Ms D

customer_reviews.title: Very good temporary bed
customer_reviews.text: I needed a compact foldable bed to use for about 3 months before moving. This bed was easy to assemble and folds very easy, only one person is needed. I’m strictly a side sleeper and this works perfect, I rarely have to flip to my other side due to arm fatigue. I HIGHLY suggest getting a mattress topper, it makes a world of difference for comfort and I have been sleeping much better. The bed still folds perfectly fine with the mattress topper so don’t worry about that. All in all, if you need a temporary bed for yourself or even guests who are visiting this is really worth the price for what you get in quality.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: Quality made. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I love this bed. It’s quality made. The mattress is a bit stiff at first, but I got used to it right away. I sleep on it every night next to my husband’s bed (he’s a hospice patient). In the morning I fold it up easily. It’s made a world of difference in our lives. Highly recommend. I have never slept on a more comfortable roll-away.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Great visit bed for 15 year old grandson who spends 3 weekends a month!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice extra bed mattress is firm so no sinking Took about 20 minutes to put on casters end rails and mattress Folds nicely for storage then just open slide 4 braces on to bolt location and lock wheels and ready for sleep Friend has another brand - only 30 wide and mattress is very soft like mine better twin width semi firm don’t sink into the frame
customer_reviews.author: NURSE J

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy.. frame not the best
customer_reviews.text: Love it so convenient and very comfortable. Very happy with my purchase. Edit: The mattress is amazing but the frame is not the best I have had to fix the tires on the bottom 3 times, they are very flimsy and bend. My opinion is the tires on the bed are way to small and cheaply made for the size of the bed.
customer_reviews.author: melissa

customer_reviews.title: Comfy enough to be worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: I slept on it for about three weeks while we had visitors and the memory foam was comfortable. You don't feel bumps and its like sleeping on a regular bed. Didn't even hurt my sensitve back. Much preferable to the air mattresses, cots and couches I've spent more than my fair share of time on.
customer_reviews.author: NiceMiddleAgedLady

customer_reviews.title: Extremely hard
customer_reviews.text: Mattress is extremely hard, now I am buying a mattress topper to make it bearable. If you definitely need a soft mattress, avoid this.
customer_reviews.author: R.C

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and easy to use...and serves it's purpose
customer_reviews.text: We had a rush of guests to our home with not enough beds...thus, our reason for ordering the bed. It is serving in its utility in that we had timely (and quick) delivery, it was easy to assemble and easy to fold away. The "sleep quality" is a much better than you'd expect from a 'roll-away' bed; however, it is still a temporary fix for an overcrowding problem. We are very satisfied with the bed for it's purposes. Easy to use, easy to assemble and serves its purpose with comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph D. Kringdon

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: I like the firmness of the mattress. Not like the smell of the mattress but got better with time. Had to expose it to outside air. Seems sturdy. First time to buy one so can't compare to other products but satisfied and happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: orchid

customer_reviews.title: A very solid bed
customer_reviews.text: Sleeping on this feels like sleeping on a bed rather than sleeping on a cot, although it is more cot height than bed height. I found it harder than expected to put together though. Some of the pieces didn't screw into the holes very easily. Took a couple of tries to get it fully assembled, but ultimately succeeded. Would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I read all the glowing reviews, so decided to give it a shot. I LOVE this bed. It’s shockingly comfortable and well made! I purchased a cover for it too, which makes it easy to store and keep clean. I am very happy with this purchase and would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: L. P.

product_meta.title: Milliard Diplomat Folding Bed – Twin Size - with Luxurious Memory Foam Mattress and a Super Strong Sturdy Frame – 75” x 38
feature_bullets: EXCEPTIONAL SUPPORT – The Diplomat distinguishes itself with a full-steel wire lattice frame that’s reinforced and overbuilt to ensure maximum sturdiness. Fold out dimensions – 75” long x 38” wide. Mattress is 73" long for proper fold up.

LUXURIOUS COMFORT – No more thin, flimsy mattresses – the Diplomat features a real foam mattress. The support foam provides a solid base and the memory foam gives you the soft, luxurious comfort your body craves. It also comes with a bonus mattress cover that’s easy to toss into the wash for a quick clean. *Mattress cover design may vary slightly.
PRACTICAL & PORTABLE – Fold up your Diplomat to a slim 14” thick profile and enjoy the smooth-rolling wheels that allow you to easily transport and store your bed anywhere.
QUICK & EASY ASSEMBLY – Assembly has never been easier for a folding bed! With the clear, illustrated manual, and all tools provided, the Diplomat’s estimated assembly time is just 5-15 minutes.
REAL SERVICE - When you purchase Milliard, you can relax knowing you have a dedicated team of real people ready to help you with any questions or concerns you may have.
